sense.name: a stopper on or in a container
sense.examples: Mary put a rubber plug in the basin to let it fill with water. Sally put a plug in the baby's mouth to stop its crying. (a pacifier) John removed the crystal plug of the decanter and poured himself a shot of cognac.

sense.name: a chewable wad of substance
sense.examples: The baseball pitcher stuffed a plug of tobacco into his cheek. Johnny blew a huge bubble from the plug of gum he'd been chewing.

sense.name: a naturally formed obstruction
sense.examples: Hardened lava formed a plug over the volcano's original vent. The patient's blood had clotted, forming a plug in an artery. John removed a plug of hair from the bathtub drain.

sense.name: a blatant promotion for something
sense.examples: Sally made a plug for her new blog site during her announcement of the speaker. The company paid for a thirty-second plug for its new energy-saving policies.

sense.name: spark generator for a combustion engine
sense.examples: The mechanic replaced the spark plugs in Mary's car. How much will a spark plug cost?

sense.name: pronged connector for an electrical socket
sense.examples: Stick the plug in the wall to see how the lights look on the Christmas tree. This vacuum cleaner has a three-pronged plug for safety.

sense.name: a fire hydrant
sense.examples: John's dog likes to mark the fire plug at the end of his street. The firemen opened the plugs and drained the water out of them.

sense.name: an old, slow horse
sense.examples: The village milkman made his rounds in a wagon drawn by an old plug.

sense.name: terminate an activity
sense.examples: The investors are pulling the plug on Tom's research project. The producers are not ready to pull the plug yet on that sit-com.
